answers.answer: Hi!In all probability you son has asthma or allergic bronchitis, and any inflammation can cause low grade fever. Many viral conditions like EBV (glandular fever) behave in this way with recurrent respiratory infections. Many parasitic infestations and worms increase the eosinophil counts in the blood and thus cause an increased risk of upper respiratory infections. If diabetes runs in the family, then this should also be looked into. He needs appropriate treatment after the cause is found.Since a confirmed diagnosis cannot be given on net please consult your son’s doctor regarding this. Hope this helps. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you.
